summary: Completed comprehensive testing of cyber-defense simulation system. All major components working correctly: attack simulation, ML-based threat detection, RL training, real-time dashboard, and MongoDB integration. System successfully generates synthetic network logs, trains ML models, detects threats, creates alerts, and displays real-time metrics.
passed_tests: All 15 backend API endpoints responding correctly (100% success rate)
Attack simulation start/stop with different intensities (low/medium/high)
Mixed traffic log generation (normal + malicious) with proper labeling
ML model training with Random Forest achieving 100% accuracy metrics
Real-time threat detection and alert generation with confidence scores
RL agent training with PPO algorithm and metrics storage
Attack frequency chart displaying real-time data
ML performance chart showing accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score
RL training progress chart (ready for data when training completes)
Live alerts feed updating every 3 seconds with HIGH severity alerts
Metrics panel showing detailed ML performance statistics
Network logs viewer displaying recent logs with proper categorization
Dashboard stats API returning correct counts (logs: 270, alerts: 358, threats: 522)
MongoDB storing logs, alerts, and metrics correctly
Real-time dashboard polling and updates working (3-5 second intervals)
Responsive design working on desktop, tablet, and mobile viewports
All control panels and charts visible and functional
Complete workflow: simulation → ML training → threat detection → alerts → dashboard display
